column4: Hello guys. I´m trying to install vmware tools in a virtualized Ubuntu. However, when I run vmware-user this error message shows up: http://i.imgur.com/XzybT.png
what is the output of:  uname -a
and the output of:  lsb_release -sc
precise
the Precise kernel is 3.2  not 2.3
Lol sorry, that was a typo
how is this an Ubuntu issue then?
IMHO is a generic linux issue. I´m just searching for the ubuntu way to solve it. ¨Libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.9´ not found¨
there is a channel for 'generic linux issues'  it's  #linux
this is for Ubuntu specific issues only
each distribution of GNU Linux has it's own channel
That´s almost true. But there´s also the fact that some distros deal with library issues in different ways.
yes tahts why they have their own channels
as the users in said channels will have an appreciation of those issues and can advise
why not try #redhat or #fedora   it appears to be a redhat kernel
I thought the problem was ubuntu specific. But thanks for the help anyway.
its not an ubuntu kernel
Neither are the C libraries. But the packaging of the libraries are ubuntu indeed.
you aren't using Ubuntu, therefore not supported here...its literally that simple
How come I´m not using ubuntu? both uname-a and lsb_release outputs indicate I´m using Ubuntu.
you aren't, Even warty warhog (the first release) uses 2.6
if you wont listen to me
I get it. I´m sorry, maybe I have expressed wrong. The 2.3.9-29 was a typo (Indeed, 2.3.29 is ancient)
